main event: On June 24, 1949, a witness in Astoria, Long Island, New York, reported sighting two flying saucers moving in a southwesterly direction at a uniform altitude and speed.
interesting points: The witness, a stable individual with a long tenure in her job, reported observing the saucers through her kitchen window while cooking dinner.
The saucers were described as approximately 1 1/2 to 2 feet in diameter, grayish in color, and surrounded by a halo of light.
They were observed to be traveling horizontally at first, then appeared to describe an upward arc before disappearing into a cloud bank.
A single-engine 'fighter type' airplane was observed to circle the area shortly after the sighting.
Although the original report remains unevaluated, it is considered to be of interest and may lead to an investigation.
